instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for the analysis of tissue parameters?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used for the analysis of tissue parameters was spectral fitting based on measured DR spectrum, pure chromophore absorption spectra, Rayleigh and Mie scattering equations, and a look-up table of DR values describing light propagation in tissue.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of CRC detection for the analysis of tissue parameters and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of CRC detection in the related study was the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC-ROC). The AUC-ROC is a commonly used metric in medical diagnostics to assess the accuracy of a binary classification model. It measures the ability of the model to distinguish between two classes (in this case, mucosa and tumor tissues) by plotting the true positive rate against the false positive rate.

The study states that successful classification with an AUC-ROC higher than 90% was achieved. This indicates that the machine learning models, combined with the extracted tissue parameters, were able to accurately differentiate between mucosa and tumor tissues in the colorectal wall. A higher AUC-ROC value suggests a better performance of the model in correctly classifying the tissues.

However, the text does not provide information on how far this metric can go in terms of its upper limit or the specific values obtained in this study.

instruction: How were machine learning models utilized in the evaluation of tissue biomolecule concentrations and scattering properties for CRC detection in the luminal wall?
Output: Machine learning models were utilized in the evaluation of tissue biomolecule concentrations and scattering properties for CRC detection in the luminal wall by combining them with the analysis of diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) within the range 350-1900 nm. The machine learning models were used to estimate parameter thresholds that would lead to the best differentiation between mucosa and tumor tissues. The most important parameters for CRC detection, as determined by the classification and regression tree algorithm, were the total lipid content (f (lipid)), the reduced scattering amplitude (alpha '), and the Mie scattering power (b (Mie)). The machine learning models were able to achieve successful classification with an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve higher than 90%.
